SENT.plain: In geriatric examinations, the old patients' looks should be observed
Based on the observation of 100 old subjects (aged 65 to 92), the author classifies the old people into 4 categories of looks
Category I can be treated easily; category 2 will co-operate in anti-depression therapy; category 3 exhibits mainly Parkinson's disease, in need of anti-sclerotic treatment
In the case of people with fixed gaze, the side-effects of drugs should also be suspected
Subjects in category 4 are difficult to treat
They do not co-operate with the physician
The administration of psychopharmacas, sedation and anti-sclerotic treatment are recommended
